installation.description: Download, install, and configure YouTube Live Tracker for the first time.

step1.title: Download
step1.description: Download the Windows x64 version. After the download is complete, run the .exe file.

step2.title: First Launch
step2.description: When you first open the application, you can select a language. 12 different languages are supported.

step3.title: Interface Overview
step3.description: The main window has 6 tabs: Stream Settings, Display Settings, Preferences, Overlay Editor, Project, and Live Preview.

youtube-connection.description: Learn how to connect to a YouTube live stream. Connect using Video ID or URL.

step1.title: Stream Settings Tab
step1.description: Go to the 'Stream Settings' tab. Enter the YouTube live stream URL or Video ID. The application automatically extracts the Video ID from the URL.
step1.codeExample:
Example URL: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VIDEO_ID
or just: VIDEO_ID

step2.title: API Key (Optional)
step2.description: You can add a YouTube Data API v3 key for advanced features. Basic features work without an API key.

step3.title: Start Stream
step3.description: Click the 'Start Stream' button. When connected, chat messages will start appearing in the 'Live Preview' tab.

overlay-creation.description: Create transparent overlay windows for streaming software.

step1.title: Overlay Editor Tab
step1.description: Go to the 'Overlay Editor' tab. If you have multiple monitors, you can select a screen.

step2.title: Enable Overlay
step2.description: Turn on the 'Overlay Active' toggle. This will create the overlay windows.

step3.title: Adding Layers
step3.description: Click the 'Add Layer' button and select the layer type: ChatBox, Subscriber, Rich Text, Camera, or Media.

step4.title: Positioning Layers
step4.description: Position the layer on the canvas by dragging and dropping. Edit position, size, and style properties from the Inspector panel.

layer-management.description: Manage, customize, and order layers with z-index.

step1.title: Layer Properties
step1.description: In the Inspector panel, you can set X, Y coordinates, width/height, opacity (0-100%), z-index, and visibility settings.

step2.title: Alignment Tool
step2.description: You can easily align layers using the 9-point alignment grid (Unity style).

step3.title: Visibility and Lock
step3.description: Use the visibility and lock buttons to hide or lock layers. Locked layers cannot be dragged.

step4.title: Real-time Preview
step4.description: The overlay window is automatically created and your changes are displayed instantly.

statistics-display.description: Display YouTube statistics (likes, viewers, subscriber count) on the overlay using Rich Text layers.

step1.title: Add Rich Text Layer
step1.description: Select and add the 'Rich Text' layer type in the Overlay Editor.

step2.title: WebAPI Tags
step2.description: Add WebAPI tags to the Rich Text content. Example: Likes: <webapi link="youtube:likes" t=30>
step2.codeExample:
Likes: <webapi link="youtube:likes" t=30>
Viewers: <webapi link="youtube:viewers" t=10>
Views: <webapi link="youtube:views" t=60>

step3.title: Update Interval
step3.description: Set the update interval for statistics using the 't' parameter (in seconds).

step4.title: Style Customization
step4.description: Set font, color, outline, shadow, and other text properties from the Inspector panel.

media-management.description: Upload and manage image, video, and audio files from the Project panel.

step1.title: Project Tab
step1.description: Go to the 'Project' tab. The file browser will be displayed.

step2.title: File Upload
step2.description: Upload files by dragging and dropping, or organize them by creating folders.

step3.title: File Operations
step3.description: Right-click on files to delete, rename, move, and download.

step4.title: Using Media Layer
step4.description: Use uploaded files in Media layers. You can set video loop, poster image, and object-fit options.
